item.description:
EUGENE ONEGIN

Sun, June 6 @ 10:15 am

Purchase tickets early.
Tickets have been known to sell out for Opera events.

$20 general / $17 seniors, students, CCT members and BLO subscribers.

Co-presented by Boston Lyric Opera.

Julie House, Education & Community Programs Manager at the Boston Lyric Opera, will be introducing this presentation.

Eugene Onegin is an opera based on the novel in verse by Aleksandr Pushkin. It is a classic of Russian literature and its eponymous protagonist served as the model for a number of Russian literary heroes. The story concerns Eugene Onegin, a selfish hero who lives to regret his blas√© rejection of a young woman's (Tatiana's) love and his careless incitement of a fatal duel with Lensky, his best friend.

2h30m with one intermission

Music by: Pyotr Tchaikovsky

Conductor: Alexander Vedemikov
Starring: Makvala Kasrashvili, Tatiana Monogarova
item.how_to_find_us: Breakfast 9:15 at Panera Bread I'll have the BIA Logo visible on Red card stock We'll catch up on film and life and head over to the theater for good seating by 10:00 am
item.name: Eugene Onegin - Opera at The Coolidge
